kpis.description: Gross profit margin measures the difference between revenue and cost of goods sold (COGS), expressed as a percentage of revenue. It indicates how efficiently a company uses its resources to produce goods.
Net profit margin indicates how much of each dollar earned translates into profits. It is calculated by dividing net profit by total revenue, expressed as a percentage.
Return on equity (ROE) measures the profitability of a company in relation to shareholders' equity. It indicates how effectively management is using a company’s assets to create profits.
The current ratio is a liquidity ratio that measures a company's ability to pay short-term obligations. It is calculated by dividing current assets by current liabilities.
Customer satisfaction scores measure how products or services supplied by a company meet or surpass customer expectations. It is often measured through surveys and feedback.
kpis.formula: (Number of Satisfied Customers / Total Number of Customers) * 100
